org.numenta.nupic.serialize

Class SerialConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.serialize.SerialConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SerialConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Used to configure a NetworkSerializer with details regarding file formats, save locations, file opening conventions, and underlying serialization library, among other things.

    This file however provides defaults which may confidently be used for full featured use, however more experienced users may want to tweak details (the first thing being whether checkpoints add new files or delete previous files maintaining only one file). For explanation of this see: StandardOpenOptions and the #SerialConfig(String, Scheme, List, StandardOpenOption...) constructor

    The check point file format is highly configurable using this class. The default format contains a "name" portion and a "timestamp" portion which may be independently configured. see setCheckPointFileName(String) and setCheckPointTimeFormatString(String).

    In addition, you may also call setOneCheckPointOnly(boolean) to overwrite the checkpoint file if you would rather not maintain multiple checkpoints.

    Author:
    cogmission
    See Also:
    NetworkTest, JavaFstNetworkSerializationTest, JavaKryoNetworkSerializationTest, NetworkSerializer, NetworkSerializerImpl, Serialized Form

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRODUCTION_OPTIONS

        public static final java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption[] PRODUCTION_OPTIONS

        The default options for the regular Network#store() method which stores the Network under the default file name "Network.ser".

        Default options are:

        • StandardOpenOption.CREATE - creates the file if it does not exist
        • StandardOpenOption.TRUNCATE_EXISTING - Truncates the file to length 0, before write to it again (basically never appends to the file which is necessary)

      • CHECKPOINT_OPTIONS

        public static final java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption[] CHECKPOINT_OPTIONS

        The default options for CheckPointer#checkPoint(rx.Observer) method which quick stores the Network state to a time-stamped file.

        Default options are:

        • StandardOpenOption.CREATE - creates the file if it does not exist
        • StandardOpenOption.TRUNCATE_EXISTING - Truncates the file to length 0, before write to it again (basically never appends to the file which is necessary)

      • SerialConfig

        public SerialConfig(java.lang.String fileName,
                    java.lang.String fileDir,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Persistable>> registeredTypes)
        Constructs a new SerialConfig which will use the specified file name Pre-registering the "known" classes which will be serialized is highly recommended. These may be specified by the list named "registeredTypes". Because the ID assigned is affected by the IDs registered before it, the order classes are registered is important when using this method. The order must be the same at deserialization as it was for serialization.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name to use
        fileDir - the directory to use.
        registeredTypes - list of classes indicating expected types to serialize

      • SerialConfig

        public SerialConfig(java.lang.String fileName,
                    java.lang.String fileDir,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Persistable>> registeredTypes,
                    java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption... openOptions)
        Constructs a new SerialConfig which will use the specified file name Pre-registering the "known" classes which will be serialized is highly recommended. These may be specified by the list named "registeredTypes". Because the ID assigned is affected by the IDs registered before it, the order classes are registered is important when using this method. The order must be the same at deserialization as it was for serialization. The OpenOptions argument specifies how the file should be opened (either create new, truncate, append, read, write etc). see (StandardOpenOption)
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name to use
        registeredTypes - list of classes indicating expected types to serialize
        openOptions - A list of options to use for how to work with the serialization file.
